data.title: Chicken pot pie
data.text: Food here was amazing ! Good prices comfortable atmosphere. Good Groupon coupon we used .  Friendly staff made us feel welcome.

data.title: WOW!
data.text: We went to the Lunch Bell for a late lunch today...i got the chicken salad and macaroni salad. i had eaten there years ago and really enjoyed it. within 15 minutes of leaving the restaurant i got suddenly sick and knew i hadn't had anything else to eat today. so i called, as a courtesy to let the Lunch Bell know and just give them a heads up. immediately the lady who answered the phone said "well you can call the health dept..." i immediately said "i never intended to call the health dept i just wanted y'all to know." i hadn't asked for anything from them. i just wanted to let them know. the lady on the other end immediately hung up on me. i have been in customer service since i started in the workforce 20 years ago and i just cant believe that i went out of my way to say "hey, just to let you know..." and they hang up on me. i will NEVER visit them again no matter how much i have liked the food in the past. WOW is all i have to say.

data.title: Great food and great staff
data.text: This was about my 8th visit and I must say that it was just as great as the first time.  The food and staff are nothing short of amazing!  We appreciate going to a place with excellent customer service, a variety of great food and a down home feel!  I will continue coming back and telling everyone that I know!!!

data.title: Yum
data.text: It is a great place for breakfast and lunch. Their desserts are fantastic. Moderate in price. But the food is very well-prepared.

data.title: Wow! Did not know it was here! Don't miss it!
data.text: Went to Newport News on business and people in my group knew about this restaurant. WOW, I am glad we went. It's only open for Breakfast and lunch and it was a bit pricey, but the food was excellent! I had crab quiche and a side salad. The quiche was awesome and was served with a side of fruit salad and a piece of cantaloupe that had jello set in the curve, very visual! One person had the Reuben and the other the Philly cheese steak, all outstanding! Don't miss their desserts!

data.title: Always Great Food
data.text:
Breakfast this morning. Perfect scrambled eggs, fluffy and moist. Excellent sausage patties and cheese biscuits. Also, the waffles were great. Our servers were friendly and efficient, as always, even though they were very busy today. 
We enjoy eating here and will be back soon.

data.title: Great Mac and cheese
data.text: This is a hole in wall spot. The place was little sketchy at first.  Waitress was nice and made you feel welcome. I got the chicken special. The mac and cheese was awesome.  Chicken was also good.  It was a special but I felt the price was high. But food is good. Would visit again.

data.title: Good food
data.text: We stopped here for lunch.It was a place that was unassuming and I think you would find in everyone's home town. It was a relaxing atmosphere and the wait staff was very friendly. The food was good too.

data.title: Lunch Bell Visit
data.text: Grits were outstanding! Great staff. Food was excellent. Apple butter was outstanding, so much so that we bought a jar.

data.title: Loved It!
data.text: We loved the food! Some of the highlights were the fried oysters, fried fish, omelet, and pancakes!!! The kids also loved the burgers. The whole family wanted to go back the next day for breakfast but they are closed on Sunday's. It was by far one of if not the best meals we had during our mini vacay in New Port News/Williamsburg area!!!

data.title: Must Visit
data.text: Came for lunch with my girlfriend and we loved it. It's in a beautiful city center with an awesome fountain you can walk around. The food was excellent and the service was warm and welcoming. They don't have places like this back home and it was extremely enjoyable. I would highly suggest visiting this place.

data.title: Breakfast was average, nothing special...
data.text: Went here for breakfast they definitely rush you for table turnover. Service is fast bordering pushy.. Not for a working breakfast. True diner style restaurant. Sweet potato pancakes w/honey butter, was good. Eggs typical as therest of our meal was typical diner breakfast fare. The coffee was a very weak and flavorless. I drink it black and add Tabasco. needed more than usual Tabasco!

data.title: Could be better
data.text: The atmosphere is that of a cafeteria,  the food was average, nothing to wright home anout. Used a Groupon voucher.

data.title: There's a reason they call it a lunch rush!
data.text:
This place is a good little lunch spot. We always get Evelyn. We love her. They do rush you though. They want you in and out because they serve so many from the surrounding businesses I guess. I've had the fried bologna. It's good. The steak sandwich was really delicious. The grilled cheese and hamburger, not so much. The fries? Not at all. Their breakfasts look good. 
I think for the price you get a substantial lunch. The fried chicken is some of the best I've had, when they have it.

data.title: Delicious Food, Made from Scratch
data.text: Love this lunch place in Newport News, Virginia. Never a bad meal. Can be a bit busy at times and a little slow service -- but other then that, try it. Very good food.

data.title: Awesome treasure
data.text: Being from the landlocked Midwest (IA), anytime I can get fresh seafoodis a great day...the lobster roll plate was the best ever!

data.title: Nice Breakfast Buffet
data.text: Had breakfast at the lunch bell yesterday.  Great buffet. I sampled scrambled eggs, bacon, ham, cheesy hash brown casserole and biscuits and gravy.  Hot pancakes brought to the table.  Many items on the buffet (sausages, country fried steak, two kinds of gravy, fruit, grits).  Tasty "down home" cooking.  Not for the calorie conscious.  Our server was friendly and kept checking on us.  Very crowded and loud.  Tables are very close together.  If you don't mind some noise, this is a good place for a filling breakfast.

data.title: A GREAT FIND
data.text: On a recent day trip to Newport News, we chanced upon the Lunch Bell, an unpretentious but absolutely first-rate restaurant. We had lunch there, although it’s open for breakfast too. One of us had a great lobster salad plate, as good as anything we’ve had in New England. Someone else had a pimento cheese and bacon sandwich and found it excellent. They make their pimento cheese in-house, like most of their other items. Everything was absolutely fresh, and portions generous. We’re sorry that we were too full for dessert, also made in-house. The specials featured things as blackberry cobbler, sour cream lemon pie and banana pudding. The setting is open and airy, and service is excellent. We enjoyed chatting with the manageress, the founders’ daughter. It’s as friendly a place as we’ve been in lately. Bottom line: we’d go back in heartbeat.

data.title: Great Lunch
data.text: My husband & I had a late lunch at The Lunch Bell.  We both had the chicken salad on their homemade roll with a cup of navy bean soup.  For dessert, we split a piece of Chocolate Crème Cake.  Everything was delicious.  Our waitress was friendly and attentive.  Their prices are reasonable.  If you have an entertainment book, there is a coupon for The Lunch Bell.

data.title: Offering a nice assortment of meals quickly for lunch
data.text: Their Hot chicken Salad is amazing, especially served with the frozen stawberrry salads,  So creamy and filling and priced in the mid range
